alert.note: Alert for Clay; Craighead; Crittenden; Cross; Greene; Lee; Mississippi; Poinsett; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued March 17 at 4:29PM CDT until March 19 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CDT SATURDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM SATURDAY TO 11 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 degrees expected. For the second Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 23 degrees expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, Southeast Missouri and West Tennessee. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CDT Saturday. For the second Freeze Warning, from 10 PM Saturday to 11 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Craighead; Crittenden; Cross; Greene; Lee; Mississippi; Poinsett; St. Francis
